newsitem.title: POLAND: Poland's Kety sees 1997 net up 20 pct.
newsitem.headline: Poland's Kety sees 1997 net up 20 pct.

text.p: Polish aluminium processor Kety SA expects to lift net profit by more than 20 percent this year and operating profit by 27 percent, the company said in a statement on Friday.
Kety also said sales would rise by 20.5 percent and that its investment costs would be 17.7 million zlotys.
The company said it planned to invest 89.8 million zlotys from 1997 to 1999.
Kety made a net profit of 29.2 million zlotys on an operating profit of 40 million zlotys and sales of 393.1 million zlotys in 1996, according to unofficial results.
The company said that from 1997 to 1999 it would strive to strengthen its position in the automotive, construction, food concentrate, sugar and fat industries.

It said its 1997 budget did not take into account its purchase on the last day of 1996 of a 47.62-percent stake in metal products maker Zaklady Elementow Wykonczenia Budownictwa Metalplast - Bielsko SA.
